trial_identification.studytitle: Long-Term follow up of Hodgkin Lymphoma Survivors: An Australian and New Zealand Patterns of Care Study
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Researcher survey assessment of the variability in current patterns of care and current and potential surveillance strategies for treatment-related late effects of Hodgkin Lymphoma Survivors: An Australian and New Zealand Patterns of Care Study

interventions.interventions: Once only online survey to invited researchers by professional group (Haematologist and Oncologist). If agree to participate in this study, then it is required that the online survey is completed, it takes 15minutes

primaryOutcome.outcome: Collection of long term follow up data. Data such as overall survival, development of second cancer will be collected via the survery
primaryOutcome.timepoint: to be distribute to select clinicians May 2009 - July 2009

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Establish patterns of care. Collection of data from the questionnaire will inform current patterns of care practiced by clinicians

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Australasian Leukaemia and Lymphoma Group member clinician treating Hodgkin Lymphoma
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: not applicable, the clinician (haematologist and oncologist) must be invited to participate in this survey.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Level 2 10 St Andrews Place East Melbourne 3002

ethicsAndSummary.summary: To describe current patterns of care of long-term *survivors of Hodgkin lymphoma across Australia and New Zealand. * For the purposes of this study, we have defined long-term survivors as those patients who are five years or more after their primary diagnosis of lymphoma
